thread.title: White House clarifies Trump tweet on pressing China to cut trade surplus

author: Str
title: White House clarifies Trump tweet on pressing China to cut trade surplus
text:
White House clarifies Trump tweet on pressing China to cut trade surplus The Trump administration is pressing China to cut its trade surplus with the U.S. by $100 billion. Trump tweeted last Wednesday that China had been asked to develop a plan to reduce its trade imbalance with the U.S. by $1 billion, but a White House spokeswoman said he had meant to say $100 billion. Published Updated Moments Ago Reuters STR | AFP | Getty Images Chinese employees working on micro and special motors for mobile phones at a factory in Huaibei, China. 
The Trump administration is pressing China to cut its trade surplus with the United States by $100 billion, a White House spokeswoman said on Wednesday, clarifying a tweet last week from President Donald Trump . 
Last Wednesday, Trump tweeted that China had been asked to develop a plan to reduce its trade imbalance with the United States by $1 billion, but the spokeswoman said Trump had meant to say $100 billion.
